Package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day07

Class CamelCards

java.lang.Object
com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day07.CamelCards
public class CamelCards extends Object
Implements solutions for both parts of day 7, reading an input file where each line specifies a card hands and bid (wager), for subsequent ranking and summing by the getWinnings() method.

After reading the input data, parts 1 and 2 both require the same type of calculation—namely, rank the hands in reverse (the hand with the lowest value has a rank of 1), multiply each rank by the bid for that hand, and sum the result. However, the two parts differ in the treatment of a Jack (represented by 'J' in the input file):

  • In part 1, Jacks are treated as usual, ranking between 10s and Queens.
  • In part 2, Jacks are Jokers—that is, they are wild. Wild Jacks in a hand are always added to the largest group (other than Jacks) of cards in the hand.
See Also:
  • "Day 7: Camel Cards".

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CamelCards(boolean jackIsWild)
    Initializes this instance, using the value of DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, with jackIsWild specifying whether the Jack card (identified as 'J' in the input) is wild.
    CamelCards(String inputFile, boolean jackIsWild)
    Initializes this instance, using inputFile as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, with jackIsWild specifying whether the Jack card (identified as 'J' in the input) is wild.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getWinnings()
    Sorts hands by value, assigns each a reversed rank (1 for the lowest-valued hand, and ascending), multiplies the rank by the bid for that hand, computes the sum of these products over all hands, and returns the result.
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of CamelCards, invokes the getWinnings() solution method, and prints the result.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CamelCards

      public CamelCards(boolean jackIsWild) throws IOException
      Initializes this instance, using the value of DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, with jackIsWild specifying whether the Jack card (identified as 'J' in the input) is wild. In other words, using this constructor is equivalent to using CamelCards(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE, jackIsWild).
      Parameters:
      jackIsWild - Specifies whether the Jack card ('J') is wild.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file referenced by DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} cannot be found or read.

    • CamelCards

      public CamelCards(String inputFile, boolean jackIsWild) throws IOException
      Initializes this instance, using inputFile as the name (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, with jackIsWild specifying whether the Jack card (identified as 'J' in the input) is wild. Each line of inputFile is parsed, extracting the five cards of the hand and the bid (wager) for that hand.
      Parameters:
      jackIsWild - Specifies whether the Jack card ('J') is wild.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file referenced by DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} cannot be found or read.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of CamelCards, invokes the getWinnings() solution method, and prints the result.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
      Throws:
      IOException - If the file referenced by DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} cannot be found or read.

    • getWinnings

      public int getWinnings()
      Sorts hands by value, assigns each a reversed rank (1 for the lowest-valued hand, and ascending), multiplies the rank by the bid for that hand, computes the sum of these products over all hands, and returns the result.
      Returns:
      Sum of (reversed rank X bid) over all hands.
